channel.title: Strange frame

item.title: Strange frame
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

Mmmm. I get where you’re coming from now.

The message ‘Welcome to Runescape’, is SUPPOSED to load on login, just not in that box.

Now that I understand completely: I have no clue what to do to fix that

Read full topic

item.title: Strange frame
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It was my sendMessage void, in the initialize, but usually it writes the string to the chatbox frame, not the full chat box frame. I’m thinking it’s because no default coords have been sent to the client, so it just assumes your a tut island.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

Im not sure.

Never seen anything like that before.

Your best bet is to get Z-File Searcher and search

Welcome to Runescape

and see where that leads you

item.title: Strange frame
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I think it’s just the way it default, when no X or Y position has been sent to the client.

item.title: Strange frame
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

It would be in your initiliaze() method.

sendFrame(Something) sendQuest(Something)

If nothing like that is there, check for pieces of code that could possibly lead to a method containing those codes like…

launchTutInterface();

Just Remove that, and if you want to clean up your source a bit, remove the launchTut void.

Read full topic

item.title: Strange frame
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I have absolutely no idea. Let me check my code, because I know I set the intial x and y to be on tut island, but I don’t think i call on them anywhere. let me check…

EDIT: Ya, I set the variables, but the aren’t called from anywhere else in the code.

Is the default method of handling that set to do it in that style?

Read full topic

Thats how all the messages in the game looked when you were still on tutorial island.

Do you know how you did that?

item.title: Strange frame
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hello, I was testing my server and all of a sudden I got this strange frame being written to the client:

I’ve never seen the chat box do that before. I haven’t been testing any strange frames, It just kind of happened.

Edit: It seems like it’s part of my sendMessage void, this is how it’s supposed to be right?

function sendMessage(player, messages) { player.outputStream.createFrameVarSize(253); player.outputStream.writeString(message); player.outputStream.endFrameVarSize(); }

Just so you know, it’s in Javascript.

Read full topic
